perturbation.original_text: Proper maintenance of books of account and financial records according to accepted accounting practices
perturbation.changed_text: Maintenance of books of account and financial records as the Managers deem appropriate
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'according to accepted accounting practices' to 'as the Managers deem appropriate,' the requirement becomes vague and open to interpretation. This contradicts the general requirement of GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles) for financial record-keeping.

perturbation.original_text: All Members will contribute their respective Capital Contributions fully and on time.
perturbation.changed_text: All Members will endeavor to contribute their respective Capital Contributions.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'will contribute' with 'will endeavor to contribute' weakens the obligation to contribute capital. This weakens the enforceability of the capital contribution clause. A simple "endeavor" does not ensure contributions are made, potentially violating the intent of the agreement and creating financial instability for the joint venture.

perturbation.original_text: The Venture will insure all its assets against loss where reasonable and standard practice in the industry.
perturbation.changed_text: The Venture may consider insuring its assets against loss if deemed necessary.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'The Venture will insure' to 'The Venture may consider insuring' and adding 'if deemed necessary,' the obligation to insure assets becomes discretionary rather than mandatory. This introduces ambiguity and contradicts the intent to protect the venture's assets, leaving it vulnerable to uncovered losses.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Business Laws regarding fiduciary duty and prudent business practices
